00020   class point_data_t{
00021   public:
00022 
00023     point_data_t()
00024     { init(); }
00025 
00026     point_data_t(const my_float_t *sample_pt)
00027     {
00028       init();
00029       x = sample_pt;
00030     }
00031 
00032     point_data_t(const point_data_t &src)
00033     {
00034       init();
00035       do_copy(src);
00036     }
00037 
00038     const point_data_t&
00039     operator=(const point_data_t &src)
00040     {
00041       if(this != &src) do_copy(src);
00042       return *this;
00043     }
00044 
00045     ~point_data_t()
00046     { ; }
00047 
00048     const my_float_t *x;  
00049     FaceAttrib::vi face;  
00050     my_float_t dist;      
00051     my_float_t B[3];      
00052

00054 
00056     void
00057     init();
00058 
00059     void
00060     do_copy(const point_data_t &src)
00061     {
00062       x = src.x;
00063       face = src.face;
00064       dist = src.dist;
00065       std::copy(src.B, src.B + 3, B);
00066     }

00076 
00087   FaceAttrib(VertAttrib::vi V0, VertAttrib::vi V1, VertAttrib::vi V2)
00088   {
00089     initialize();
00090     A_V[0] = V0;
00091     A_V[1] = V1;
00092     A_V[2] = V2;
00093     my_float_t U[3], V[3];
00094     vector(3, A_V[0]->pos, A_V[1]->pos, U);
00095     vector(3, A_V[2]->pos, A_V[1]->pos, V);
00096     cross(U, V, A_normal);
00097     A_area = normalize(A_normal);
00098   }
00099 
00101   FaceAttrib(const FaceAttrib& F)
00102   {
00103     initialize();
00104     do_copy(F);
00105   }
00106

00109   operator=(const FaceAttrib& F)
00110   {
00111     if(&F != this) do_copy(F);
00112     return *this;
00113   }

00126   void
00127   set_vertices(VertAttrib::vi V0, VertAttrib::vi V1, VertAttrib::vi V2)
00128   {
00129     A_V[0] = V0;
00130     A_V[1] = V1;
00131     A_V[2] = V2;
00132     my_float_t U[3], V[3];
00133     vector(3, A_V[0]->pos, A_V[1]->pos, U);
00134     vector(3, A_V[2]->pos, A_V[1]->pos, V);
00135     cross(U, V, A_normal);
00136     A_area = normalize(A_normal);

00140   void
00141   add_sample_pt(const my_float_t *pt)
00142   { A_X.push_back(pt); }
00143     
00144   void
00145   get_other_verts(const VertAttrib::vci V, VertAttrib::vi A, VertAttrib::vi B)
00146   { 
00147     if(A_V[0] == V){
00148       A = A_V[1];
00149       B = A_V[2];
00150     }else if(A_V[1] == V){
00151       A = A_V[2];
00152       B = A_V[0];
00153     }else if(A_V[2] == V){
00154       A = A_V[0];
00155       B = A_V[1];
00156     }else{
00157       A = VertAttrib::NULL_VI;
00158       B = VertAttrib::NULL_VI;
00159     }
00160   }

00187   FaceAttrib::vi 
00188   next(VertAttrib::vi V) const
00189   {
00190     if(V == A_V[0]) return A_fnei[2];
00191     else if(V == A_V[1]) return A_fnei[0];
00192     else if(V == A_V[2]) return A_fnei[1];
00193     else{
00194       std::cerr << "The vertex for FaceAttrib::next() is not a vertex of "
00195                 << "the face\n";
00196       return FaceAttrib::NULL_VI;
00197     }
00198   }
00199 
00203   FaceAttrib::vi
00204   prev(VertAttrib::vi V) const
00205   {
00206     if(V == A_V[0]) return A_fnei[0];
00207     else if(V == A_V[1]) return A_fnei[1];
00208     else if(V == A_V[2]) return A_fnei[2];
00209     else{ 
00210       std::cerr << "The vertex for FaceAttrib::prev() is not a vertex of "
00211                 << "the face\n";
00212       return FaceAttrib::NULL_VI;
00213     }
00214   } 
00215 
00216   bool
00217   set_face_neighbor(VertAttrib::vi V0, VertAttrib::vi V1, FaceAttrib::vi nbr)
00218   {
00219     if((V0 == A_V[0] && V1 == A_V[1]) || (V0 == A_V[1] && V1 == A_V[0]))
00220       A_fnei[0] = nbr;
00221     else if((V0 == A_V[1] && V1 == A_V[2]) || (V0 == A_V[2] && V1 == A_V[1]))
00222       A_fnei[1] = nbr;
00223     else if((V0 == A_V[2] && V1 == A_V[0]) || (V0 == A_V[0] && V1 == A_V[2]))
00224       A_fnei[2] = nbr;
00225     else{
00226     
00227 //      std::cerr << "One or more of the vertices in set_face_neigbor() is not "
00228 //                << "in the current face\n";
00229       return false;
00230     }
00231     return true;
00232   }
00233   
00234   void
00235   get_vertices(VertAttrib::vi *V) const
00236   {
00237     std::copy(A_V, A_V + 3, V);
00238   }

00240   static void
00241   test_removing_edge(VertAttrib::vi *end_pts, FaceAttrib::vi *edge_faces,
00242                      VertAttrib::vi verts_begin)
00243   {
00244 /*
00245     std::cout << "End points (vertices): " 
00246               << end_pts[0] - verts_begin << " " 
00247               << end_pts[1] - verts_begin << "\n";
00248 
00249     std::cout << "faces:\n"
00250               << "\tvertices: "
00251               << edge_faces[0]->A_V[0] - verts_begin << " "
00252               << edge_faces[0]->A_V[1] - verts_begin << " "
00253               << edge_faces[0]->A_V[2] - verts_begin << "\n"
00254               << edge_faces[1]->A_V[0] - verts_begin << " "
00255               << edge_faces[1]->A_V[1] - verts_begin << " "
00256               << edge_faces[1]->A_V[2] - verts_begin << "\n\n";
00257 */
00258 
00259     // Get a copy of the top right (TR), bottom right (SR), top left (TL)
00260     // and bottom left (SL) when the edge is oriented such that v_t is the
00261     // top and v_s is the bottom vertex
00262     std::vector<FaceAttrib> temp_faces(4);
00263     temp_faces[0] = *(edge_faces[0]->next(end_pts[0]));
00264     temp_faces[1] = *(edge_faces[1]->prev(end_pts[0]));
00265     temp_faces[2] = *(edge_faces[0]->prev(end_pts[1]));
00266     temp_faces[3] = *(edge_faces[1]->next(end_pts[1]));
00267     FaceAttrib::vi TR = temp_faces.begin();
00268     FaceAttrib::vi TL = temp_faces.begin() + 1;
00269     FaceAttrib::vi SR = temp_faces.begin() + 2;
00270     FaceAttrib::vi SL = temp_faces.begin() + 3;
00271 /*
00272     std::cout << "TR:  "
00273               << temp_faces[0].A_V[0] - verts_begin << " "
00274               << temp_faces[0].A_V[1] - verts_begin << " "
00275               << temp_faces[0].A_V[2] - verts_begin << "\n\n"
00276               << "TL:  "
00277               << temp_faces[1].A_V[0] - verts_begin << " "
00278               << temp_faces[1].A_V[1] - verts_begin << " "
00279               << temp_faces[1].A_V[2] - verts_begin << "\n\n";
00280 */
00281 
00282     // Change the face neighbors for TR, SR, TL and SL as they would be
00283     // if the given edge was removed
00284     TR->A_fnei[edge_faces[0]->prev_fnei_idx(end_pts[0])] = SR;
00285     SR->A_fnei[edge_faces[0]->next_fnei_idx(end_pts[0])] = TR;
00286     TL->A_fnei[edge_faces[1]->prev_fnei_idx(end_pts[1])] = SL;
00287     SL->A_fnei[edge_faces[1]->next_fnei_idx(end_pts[1])] = TL;
00288   
00289     // Test with 3 different starting locations
00290     std::vector<VertAttrib> new_vert(3);  
00291     new_vert[0] = *(end_pts[0]);
00292     new_vert[1] = *(end_pts[1]);
00293     for(int i = 0; i < 3; ++i) 
00294       new_vert[2].pos[i] = 0.5*(end_pts[0]->pos[i] + end_pts[1]->pos[1]);
00295     // don't forget to update normal at the end
00296 
00297     // We now need to replace the iterator to the VertAttribs corresponding
00298     // to the end points of the edge to remove in TR, SR, TL, and SL
00299     TR->replace_vert(end_pts[0], new_vert.begin());
00300     TL->replace_vert(end_pts[0], new_vert.begin());
00301     SR->replace_vert(end_pts[1], new_vert.begin());
00302     SL->replace_vert(end_pts[1], new_vert.begin());
00303 
00304     // We need to be careful as we cannot rotate about vertices to get
00305     // all of the faces :( using the copies since we are not actually
00306     // modifying the mesh
00307     // Thus for each triangle that has one of the end_points as a vertex,
00308     // we need to get all of it's neighbor triangles
00309     
00310     std::vector<FaceAttrib::vi> faces_of_edge;
00311     // get_faces does not add the starting face to the vector
00312     // this way faces do not get counted twice
00313     get_faces(end_pts[0], edge_faces[0], &faces_of_edge);
00314     get_faces(end_pts[1], edge_faces[1], &faces_of_edge);
00315     
00316     // For each face in the faces the share exactly one vertex with
00317     // the edge, get all their neighbor faces.  
00318     std::vector< std::vector<FaceAttrib::vi> > nbrs_of_edge_faces;
00319     for(size_t i = 0; i < faces_of_edge.size(); ++i){
00320       // Ignore the two faces that share the edge as they are getting optimized
00321       // out
00322       if(faces_of_edge[i] == edge_faces[0] || faces_of_edge[i] == edge_faces[1])
00323         continue;
00324 
00325       std::vector<FaceAttrib::vi> tmp_vec;
00326       nbrs_of_edge_faces.push_back(tmp_vec);
00327       get_faces(faces_of_edge[i],  &nbrs_of_edge_faces.back());
00328   
00329       // If a face is TR, TL, SR, or SL get all the faces for it and
00330       // then replace it with the modified local copy of that face (it is the
00331       // first face in the most recently added vector)
00332       // TR
00333       if(faces_of_edge[i] == edge_faces[0]->next(end_pts[0])){
00334         nbrs_of_edge_faces.back()[0] = TR;
00335       // SR
00336       }else if(faces_of_edge[i] == edge_faces[0]->prev(end_pts[0])){
00337         nbrs_of_edge_faces.back()[0] = SR;
00338       // TL
00339       }else if(faces_of_edge[i] == edge_faces[1]->next(end_pts[1])){
00340         nbrs_of_edge_faces.back()[0] = TL;
00341       // SL
00342       }else if(faces_of_edge[i] == edge_faces[1]->prev(end_pts[1])){
00343         nbrs_of_edge_faces.back()[0] = SL;
00344       }
00345     }
00346 
00347     // For each vector in nbrs_of_edge_faces, the first face is the
00348     // one for which we need to check the point distances (A_X) in that face
00349     // to all the faces in the current vector
00350     // Cheat and use a map for now -- too tired to think straight 
00351 //    std::map< FaceAttrib::vi, std::vector<const my_float_t*> >new_correspondences; 
00352 
00353     std::vector<point_data_t> correspondences;
00354 
00355     for(size_t i = 0; i < nbrs_of_edge_faces.size(); ++i){
00356       std::vector<FaceAttrib::vi> &nbrs = nbrs_of_edge_faces[i];
00357       FaceAttrib::vi curr_face = nbrs[0];
00358       std::vector<const my_float_t*>::const_iterator x;
00359       for(x = curr_face->A_X.begin(); x < curr_face->A_X.end(); ++x){
00360         // Check distance of *x to each face in nbrs_of_edg_faces[i] 
00361         // Keep the lowest distance + barycenter coords for the projection
00362 
00363         // If the current face is TR or SR also check the points for edge_faces[0]
00364         // If the current face is TL or SL also check the points for edge_faces[1]
00365 
00366         point_data_t best_proj(*x);
00367         std::vector<FaceAttrib::vi>::iterator face_iter;
00368         for(face_iter = nbrs.begin(); face_iter < nbrs.end(); ++face_iter){
00369           FaceAttrib::vi face = *face_iter;
00370 
00371           // project point to current face
00372           my_float_t x_in_face_plane[3];
00373           my_float_t d = face->proj_pt_to_plane(*x, x_in_face_plane);
00374 
00375           // get barycentric coords -- if not if face, see if we can use
00376           my_float_t B[3];
00377           //bool pt_in_face = face->barycentric_coords(x_in_face_plane, B);
00378           face->barycentric_coords(x_in_face_plane, B);
00379               std::cout << "\nbarycentric coords for face: ";
00380               std::cout << "B[0]: " << B[0] ;
00381               std::cout << "   B[1]: " << B[1] ;
00382               std::cout << "   B[2]: " << B[2]  << "\n";
00383 
00384           if(d < best_proj.dist){
00385             best_proj.dist = d; 
00386             std::copy(B, B + 3, best_proj.B);
00387             best_proj.face = face;
00388           } 
00389         }
00390 
00391         if(best_proj.face == FaceAttrib::NULL_VI){
00392           std::cerr << "Error in gettin face for a sample point\n\n";
00393         }else{
00394           correspondences.push_back(best_proj);  
00395         }
00396       }
00397     }
00398   }
00399 
00400   my_float_t
00401   proj_pt_to_plane(const my_float_t *pt, my_float_t *proj_pt) const
00402   {
00403     // Get a vector from one of the vertices to the point
00404     my_float_t V[3]; 
00405     vector(3, pt, A_V[0]->pos, V);
00406     std::cout << "The vector V[0] -> pt: " << V[0] << " " << V[1] << " " 
00407               << V[2] << "\n";
00408     std::cout << "normal to face: " << A_normal[0] << " " << A_normal[1] << " "
00409               << A_normal[2] << "\n";
00410 
00411     // signed distance from pt to plane
00412     my_float_t rv = dot(A_normal, V);
00413     std::cout << "Signed dist to plane: " << rv << "\n";
00414 
00415     // Project the point by adding the negative of rv times the normal to the 
00416     // given point
00417     std::copy(pt, pt + 3, proj_pt);
00418     my_axpy(3, -1.0 * rv, A_normal, 1, proj_pt, 1);
00419     return rv;
00420   }

00422   friend std::ostream& 
00423   operator<<(std::ostream &out, const FaceAttrib& F)
00424   { 
00425     for(int i = 0; i < 3; ++i)
00426       out << F.A_V[i]->pos[0] << " " << F.A_V[i]->pos[1] << " " 
00427           << F.A_V[i]->pos[2] << " ";
00428 
00429     return out;
00430   }

00440   void
00441   do_copy(const FaceAttrib& F)
00442   {
00443     std::copy(F.A_V, F.A_V + 3, A_V);
00444     std::copy(F.A_fnei, F.A_fnei + 3, A_fnei);
00445     A_X.resize(F.A_X.size());
00446     std::copy(F.A_X.begin(), F.A_X.end(), A_X.begin());
00447     std::copy(F.A_normal, F.A_normal + 3, A_normal);
00448     A_area = F.A_area;
00449   }
00450 
00454   size_t
00455   next_fnei_idx(VertAttrib::vi V) const
00456   {
00457     if(V == A_V[0]) return 2;
00458     else if(V == A_V[1]) return 0;
00459     else if(V == A_V[2]) return 1;
00460     else{
00461       std::cerr << "The vertex for FaceAttrib::next() is not a vertex of "
00462                 << "the face\n";
00463       return 100000;
00464     }
00465   }
00466 
00470   size_t
00471   prev_fnei_idx(VertAttrib::vi V) const
00472   {
00473     if(V == A_V[0]) return 1;
00474     else if(V == A_V[1]) return 2;
00475     else if(V == A_V[2]) return 0;
00476     else{
00477       std::cerr << "The vertex for FaceAttrib::prev() is not a vertex of "
00478                 << "the face\n";
00479       return 100000;
00480     }
00481   }
00482 
00484   bool
00485   replace_vert(VertAttrib::vi V_old, VertAttrib::vi V_new)
00486   {
00487     if(V_old == A_V[0]) A_V[0] = V_new;
00488     else if(V_old == A_V[1]) A_V[1] = V_new;
00489     else if(V_old == A_V[2]) A_V[2] = V_new;
00490     else{
00491       std::cerr << "The old vertex for FaceAttrib::replace_vert() is not a "
00492                 << "vertex of the face\n";
00493       return false;
00494     }
00495     return true;
00496   }

00499 
00507   static bool 
00508   get_faces(const VertAttrib::vi &central_vert,
00509             const FaceAttrib::vi &start_face,
00510             std::vector<FaceAttrib::vi> *faces_out,
00511             const bool skip_first_prev = false)
00512   { 
00513     if(start_face == FaceAttrib::NULL_VI) return false;
00514     FaceAttrib::vi F = start_face->next(central_vert);
00515     for( ; F != start_face && F != FaceAttrib::NULL_VI;  
00516         F = F->next(central_vert))
00517       faces_out->push_back(F);
00518   
00519     // Try the prev links if there is a "gap"
00520     if(F == FaceAttrib::NULL_VI){
00521       F = start_face->prev(central_vert);
00522       if(F != FaceAttrib::NULL_VI && skip_first_prev) F = F->prev(central_vert);
00523       for( ; F != start_face && F != FaceAttrib::NULL_VI;
00524           F = F->prev(central_vert))
00525         faces_out->push_back(F);
00526     }
00527   }
00528     
00529   static bool
00530   get_faces(FaceAttrib::vi central_face,
00531             std::vector<FaceAttrib::vi> *faces_out)
00532   {
00533     faces_out->push_back(central_face);
00534   
00535     VertAttrib::vi central_verts[3];
00536     central_face->get_vertices(central_verts);
00537 
00538     // The nice idea gets messier here when we try to deal with 
00539     // special cases.  Ideally, we would traverse each circular array
00540     // starting with the next face after the central face and not add
00541     // the starting face for that traversal as it is covered by the 
00542     // (next, previous) traversel.  When we hit boundaries, we use
00543     // prev as well to see how far we can get, if the next face does not
00544     // exist then we need to start with the central face and we do not
00545     // want get_faces to add central face
00546     for(int i = 0; i < 3; ++i){
00547       FaceAttrib::vi next_face = central_face->next(central_verts[i]);
00548       if(next_face != FaceAttrib::NULL_VI)
00549         get_faces(central_verts[i], next_face, faces_out, true);
00550       else
00551         get_faces(central_verts[i], central_face, faces_out, false);
00552     }
00553     return true;
00554   }

00557   bool
00558   not_sharp(VertAttrib::vi A, VertAttrib::vi B)
00559   { return false; }

00562   E_disc(VertAttrib::vi V_s, VertAttrib::vi V_t, VertAttrib::vi V_l,
00563          VertAttrib::vi V_r,
00564          bool(*sharpFunc)(VertAttrib::vi A, VertAttrib::vi B))
00565   {
00566     return 0.0;
00567   }

00569   VertAttrib::vi A_V[3];       
00570   FaceAttrib::vi A_fnei[3];    
00571   // should store these elsewhere ?
00572   std::vector<const my_float_t*> A_X;
00573   //point_storage<point_t> A_X; //!< Points of X that could project to this face
00574 
00575   my_float_t A_normal[3]; 
00576   my_float_t A_area;
